## HttpDirectoryReaderContext interface

Context utilities provided to an [HttpDirectoryReader](doc/markdown/./base.httpdirectoryreader.md)<!-- -->.

A reader implementation uses these helpers to fetch remote resources, resolve/normalize paths, and infer MIME types without depending on the VFS internals.

**Signature:**

```typescript
interface HttpDirectoryReaderContext 
```

## Properties

<table><thead><tr><th>

Property


</th><th>

Modifiers


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[fetch](doc/markdown/./base.httpdirectoryreadercontext.fetch.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

(url: string, init?: RequestInit) =&gt; Promise&lt;Response&gt;


</td><td>

Fetch helper with the same signature as `window.fetch`<!-- -->, usually wrapped with timeouts/headers/credentials by the hosting VFS.

Implementations should use this instead of calling `fetch` directly.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[guessMimeType](doc/markdown/./base.httpdirectoryreadercontext.guessmimetype.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

(name: string) =&gt; string \| undefined


</td><td>

Best-effort MIME type inference based on a file name or path.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[joinPath](doc/markdown/./base.httpdirectoryreadercontext.joinpath.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

(...parts: string\[\]) =&gt; string


</td><td>

Joins multiple path segments and normalizes the result.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[normalizePath](doc/markdown/./base.httpdirectoryreadercontext.normalizepath.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

(path: string) =&gt; string


</td><td>

Normalizes a VFS path into canonical form.

Readers should use this to sanitize incoming paths and to build stable `FileMetadata.path` values.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[toURL](doc/markdown/./base.httpdirectoryreadercontext.tourl.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

(path: string) =&gt; string


</td><td>

Converts a VFS path to an absolute URL that can be fetched.

Data URIs and object URLs should pass through unchanged.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
